result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey G Lex was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeffrey G Lex was found guilty of Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Credit For Time Served 8 Days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine/Fee/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision at the rate of $100.00 per month after the 3rd month of Extended Supervision, alternate 25 days Jail if not paid.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Blood Test Reimbursement:  $35.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision to the Waukesha County CIrcuit Court to be forwarded to the New Berlin Police Department.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Be involved in a 12 step program within 30 days of release.
Attend 2 self help meetings per week.
Operate a motor vehicle with a valid driver's license.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Count #7 was Dismissed.  Case #15CF475 was Dismissed and Read into Case #14CF915.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jeffrey G Lex in court with Attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #4 & 5. Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #4 & 5.  Counts #1, 2, 3 and 6 are dismissed and read-in.  Count #7 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Barbara V. makes statements.  James H. makes statements.  Attorney Kuchler makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #4: IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

66 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 8 days)
  -  30 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  36 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed/sign releases
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*12 step program within 30 days of release
*Attend 2 self-help meetings per week 
*Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation - to be forward to New Berlin Police Department);

FINE:  $2,562.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $100.00 per month after 3rd month of extended supervision, alternate 25 days jail if not paid)


COUNT #5:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

36 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT                         **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #4**
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS     **CONCURRENT**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed/sign releases
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*12 step program within 30 days of release
*Attend 2 self-help meetings per week 
*Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
*20 Hours of Community Service for each year of probation

COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

NOTE: BAIL MONEY POSTED ON THIS CASE AND ON CASE #15CF475 IS TO BE RETURNED TO POSTER

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless he has a license.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.

Defendant Jeffrey G Lex in court with attorney Donna Jean Kuchler.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer James A. from the City of New Berlin was sworn and testified on behalf of the State.  State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments and moves for dismissal.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Defense presents bail arguments. State has no objections.  Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
